items.content_html:
Description

Running the program exactly as-is at this point will return the following error:
Error: Cannot find module 'express-validator'
The tutorial either needs to instruct people to install express-validator or comment out the code for now.

Motivation

Following the tutorial exactly as written should not result in errors. Another solution would be to not include the express-validator line at this point, but add it at a later time when the tutorial actually requests installing and using the module.
const { body, validationResult } = require("express-validator");

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add note about module not yet installed

items.content_html:
This PR adds a How-to for triggering the installation process from inside the app, using beforeinstallprompt. Having dug into this event a bit for #26828 I thought I might as well write the how-to up.

A couple of questions:

  • arguably we might want to make this "how to customize app install" and include stuff about customizing the prompt itself. But I didn't do that partly because these seem like quite distinct things to want to do, and partly because this bit is done and we can merge it, and the other stuff isn't.
  • I wrote a mini-PWA to test this out. It made me wonder if we should have mini-examples in mdn/pwa-examples for how-to guides. It's nice having working code to back this stuff up.
  • I wasn't sure about appinstalled, or if there is more to be said there. I was a bit surprised actually that although I call preventDefault() I still get the icon in the URL bar.
items.title: PWA How-to: trigger installation from a PWA

items.content_html:
Description

I think there was a mistake in the docs.

Motivation

The output of the FFT operation is plotted in the Frequency and Amplitude domains (not in time domain).

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Replace reference to time domain with amplitude domain in `AnalyserNode .fftSize`

items.content_html:
The current page for decodeAudioData() is bad at explaining the newer promise-based syntax, and it is the newer, better way to go. These edits update the page to reflect the newer reality of promises and async/await.
I have also created an updated example web page for webaudio-examples. That PR is here: mdn/webaudio-examples#104
I am a bit worried by a mistake I made in my last PR to this repo: I never created a separate branch, I committed to my main branch. Now those commits are in this new dAD branch and I don't know if that screws up your merge. Let me know if there is anything I should do about that and if I need to create a new PR as a result.
items.title: New and improved promise-based syntax examples and other edits

items.content_html:
Fixes #26048.

Documents security requirements for WindowClient.focus() and Clients.openWindow().

I believe that although the bug report quotes a SO answer that the requirement is that the methods may only be called inside a notificationclick handler, that's a very old answer, and from the spec it looks as if the requirement is transient activation:

https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#clients-openwindow
https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#client-focus

I wasn't quite sure what "this origin" means here. I have documented it as "the app's origin" but not sure that is correct.
items.title: Fix issue 26048: document security requirements for opening and focusâ€¦

items.content_html:
Description

remove all the content suffix in examples

Motivation

Additional details
items.title: chore: remove all the `content` suffix in examples

items.content_html:
Description

The direction property, while not deprecated, is heavily discouraged by the CSS Spec authors. This PR adds this warning to the direction property page.

Motivation

As MDN is often the first stop for developers exploring CSS properties, this warning should be present here. A similar warning is posted about unicode-bidi.

Additional details

from https://drafts.csswg.org/css-writing-modes-3/#direction

Because HTML UAs can turn off CSS styling, we recommend HTML authors to use the HTML dir attribute and element to ensure correct bidirectional layout in the absence of a style sheet. Authors should not use direction in HTML documents.

CSS WG discussion on the topic: w3c/csswg-drafts#2091

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add warning to CSS direction page

items.content_html:
The pages for BeforeInstallPromptEvent are incomplete and wrong in various ways:

  • pages for all members except prompt() are missing
  • in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BeforeInstallPromptEvent the summary for userChoice incorrectly says it resolves to a string
  • in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BeforeInstallPromptEvent/prompt it is incorrectly claimed that the result object has a userChoice member, and that its platform member reflects the platform property (there isn't a platform property, it's platforms).
  • examples are a bit odd, as in not the kind of thing you would ever do with this event.

Since AFAICT it's non-standard, I've documented with what I could find in Chrome (from testing and looking at https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/app_banner/before_install_prompt_event.idl) rather than what's in https://wicg.github.io/manifest-incubations/#beforeinstallpromptevent-interface . If we think this is a good plan I'll need to update BCD a bit as well.

I wasn't really sure what BeforeInstallPromptEvent.platforms is. I'm also not sure my code samples are that good.
items.title: Update beforeinstallpromptevent

items.content_html:
Fixes #9193.

It's a bit tricky, because there isn't an official binary distribution of OpenSSL, AFAIK, and I don't want to link to unofficial sources. But the OpenSSL project does have a list of such links, which are probably usable.

I also rearranged things a bit to make it clearer that we are talking about three different approaches here.
items.title: Fix 9193: clarify where to get OpenSSL

items.content_html: Fixes #26739, based on https://web.dev/bfcache/#only-add-beforeunload-listeners-conditionally.
items.title: Fix issue 26739: correct beforeunload situation wrt bfcache

items.content_html:
Description

  • Change /docs/ links to /en-US/docs/
  • Add missing {{WebExtAPIRef in declarativenetrequest/index.md

Motivation

There is a missing {{WebExtAPIRef in the DNR article. I might have overlooked it before because the bot was spitting out tons of "useless" warnings about non-resolvable URLs. I fixed it by replacing /docs/ with /en-US/docs/, and then /en-US/en-US/docs/ with /en-US/docs/.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

This is a follow-up to #26793
items.title: DNR docs: replace /docs with /en-US/docs + fix missing WebExtAPIRef

items.content_html:
Firefox is the only widely used engine not supporting -webkit-text-security, and it seems to be in use in the wild to conceal password fields, as per this webcompat.com report. Chrome Platform Status implies that its usage is low (~0.3%), but slowly growing.

Description

whatwg/compat#240

Motivation

Fixed in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1826629 and released in Firefox 114.

Additional details

  • https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/rev/c5031904ac17
  • https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/rev/0b42da869302
items.title: Add the support for -webkit-text-security in Release 114

items.content_html:
This pull request removes instances of {{EmbedLiveSample}} macro where a third fourth parameter is provided.

  • Most of these are empty: {{EmbedLiveSample('title', 'width', 'height', '')}}
  • Ones with screenshots are presumably fallbacks when browsers did not support the features demonstrated. Deleting the screenshots in this case as the live sample renders well by itself so a screenshot is redundant.

Other changes:

  • Fixing duplicate section headings, using bold text instead for some sections.
items.title: chore: Remove embedlivesample macro calls with a fourth parameter

items.content_html:
Length values are not always absolute. For example we can use 2em for height property as a length value but it is not absolute. I corrected this in the Values section.

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Correct length values description

items.content_html:
Description

Migrates URLs linking to https://media.prod.mdn.mozit.cloud/ to point to the archived URL at https://mdn.dev/archives/media/.

Motivation

The contents of https://media.prod.mdn.mozit.cloud/ have been archived at https://mdn.dev/archives/media/, and we will soon decommission the media.prod.mdn.mozit.cloud domain, so those links won't work afterwards.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Related:

  • mdn/yari#8873
  • mdn/translated-content#13291
items.title: refactor: migrate media.prod.mdn.mozit.cloud URLs

items.content_html:
Description

Fx114 adds support for the inverted-colors media feature.
The support is behind the layout.css.inverted-colors.enabled flag, which is false by default.

This PR updates the existing content page and adds an entry to the the experimental features page.

On the content page:

  • The "Experimental banner" ({{SeeCompatTable}}) is added because the feature is not supported in any browser and supported in Firefox only now.
  • A few edits have been done for clarity and for aligning with the template.

Additional details

Spec: https://drafts.csswg.org/mediaqueries-5/#inverted

Related issues and pull requests

Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1794628
Doc issue: #26691
BCD PR: mdn/browser-compat-data#19881
items.title: docs(fx114): inverted-colors reference page and relnote updates

items.content_html:
Description

This PR contains a new PWA guide focused on providing high-level best practices for people looking to build the best PWAs possible.

Motivation

We are in the process of re-writing the PWA docs on MDN with @estelle and @wbamberg and have already written a number of guides and how-to tutorials.

We feel like there should also be a Best Practices article in there. That's what this PR does.

Additional details

N/A

Related issues and pull requests

mdn/mdn#280
items.title: New PWA best practices guide
